name: unmounted
content:
unmounted adjective
(NOT DISPLAYED)
Add to word list
Add to word list
If a piece of jewellery, art, etc., is unmounted, it is not set on or attached to something to display it: 24 carats refers to the weight of the unmounted diamond, before it is set into a ring. All photographs submitted to the contest should be unmounted and cut to size.
More examplesFewer examplesHe was a dealer in wholesale, unmounted diamonds.Unmounted stones require no maintenance other than cleaning.She showed me a strip of six unmounted slides.

unmounted adjective
(NOT ON HORSE)
not riding a horse or other animal, or (of an animal) without a rider: Two dozen unmounted police officers were on patrol at the parade. The painting shows an unmounted white charger loose on the battlefield.
More examplesFewer examplesA minute's silence was observed by all the riders, who walked into the arena unmounted. Most armies contained large numbers of unmounted soldiers such as spearmen and archers.

unmounted adjective
(COMPUTER)
computing
  specialized (of a disk or disk drive) no longer available for use on a computer: Once unmounted, a CD-ROM can be automatically ejected. Related word
unmount
More examplesFewer examplesThe program closes the control files of the unmounted database.Ideally, all backups would be performed after working hours on unmounted filesystems.Once unmounted, the virtual drives are no longer available or visible to the search engine.
